perturbation.original_text: Each party will maintain, during the Term and for three (3) years thereafter, such comprehensive general liability insurance (including without limitation, products liability) as will adequately protect it against its potential liabilities under this Agreement, in amounts customary in the semiconductor industry for similar services and products. Each party will, at the other party’s request, provide to the other party a certificate of insurance evidencing the foregoing insurance coverage.
perturbation.changed_text: Each party will maintain general liability insurance as will protect it against its potential liabilities under this Agreement. Each party may, at the other party’s discretion, provide a certificate of insurance evidencing the insurance coverage.
perturbation.explanation: Removing 'comprehensive,' the specific timeframe 'for three (3) years thereafter,' and 'amounts customary in the semiconductor industry' weakens the insurance requirement. Changing 'will' to 'may' in the certificate provision makes compliance optional, violating general principles that mandate insurance coverage to remain in place.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles requiring adequate insurance coverage to protect against liabilities, particularly relevant in California where the contract is governed.

perturbation.original_text: In the event that such audit reveals an underpayment of Royalties or Service Fees owed by DIALOG, DIALOG will promptly pay ENERGOUS the amount of the underpayment. If such underpayment is in excess of [***] of the Royalties or Service Fee due for the period audited, DIALOG will also reimburse ENERGOUS for its reasonable, out-of-pocket cost of such audit. In the event that such audit reveals an overpayment of Royalties or Service Fees owed by DIALOG, ENERGOUS will promptly pay DIALOG the amount of the overpayment.
perturbation.changed_text: In the event that such audit reveals an underpayment of Royalties or Service Fees owed by DIALOG, DIALOG may pay ENERGOUS the amount of the underpayment. In the event that such audit reveals an overpayment of Royalties or Service Fees owed by DIALOG, ENERGOUS may pay DIALOG the amount of the overpayment.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'will' to 'may' makes the payment of underpayment and overpayment optional, violating accounting regulations and fair business practices.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Accounting regulations and fair business practices.

perturbation.original_text: Each party will comply with all law and regulations applicable such party’s performance under this Agreement, including but not limited to U.S. Export Administration laws and regulations and any other export, import and re-export control laws applicable to such party. The parties will refrain from exporting or re-exporting the Products or Product IP or any technical data or other materials received from each other, or the direct product of any of these, to any country, individual or organization proscribed by the United States government, unless properly authorized by the appropriate agencies of the United States government. Each party will provide all information under its control which is necessary or useful for the other party to ship or receive the Products, including, but not limited to, U.S. Export Control Classification Numbers (ECCNs), U.S. Customs Certificates of Delivery, Certificates of Origin and U.S. Federal Communications Commission identifier, if applicable. Each party agrees that it will not act in any fashion or take any action in violation of any applicable anti-bribery or anti-corruption legislation in any jurisdiction in which it does business, which prohibits the offering, giving or promising to offer or give, directly or indirectly, money or anything of value to any official of a government, political party or instrumentality to assist it in obtaining or retaining business, including the U.S. Foreign Corrupt Practices Act or any comparable legislation in another country.
perturbation.changed_text: Each party will try to comply with all laws and regulations applicable to such party. The parties will try to refrain from exporting to proscribed countries unless authorized. Each party may provide information necessary for the other party to ship or receive the Products. Each party agrees that it will try to not act in violation of anti-bribery legislation.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'will comply' to 'will try to comply', 'will refrain' to 'will try to refrain', 'will provide' to 'may provide', and 'will not act' to 'will try to not act' weakens the obligation to comply with laws, especially export regulations and anti-bribery laws.
perturbation.contradicted_law: U.S. Export Administration Regulations, Foreign Corrupt Practices Act, and other similar international laws.
